…….and folks, we’re back to your regularly scheduled melon-twisting, eye-popping, destroying-every-notion-you-ever-had-of-wine-pricing --- yes….GROTH RESERVE CABERNET! 


Hey, we know you are still doing T-day dishes, but PLEASE, do whatever you must to take a 30-second break and make absolutely sure you get some of THIS!! 95 POINTS, best-ever price, and….GROTH RESERVE! C’mon! One of Napa Valley’s all-time greats!


Many hardcore Cabernet geeks recall that Groth might be best remembered for the FIRST 100-point score for a CA wine back in 1985. Well, Groth is BACK, in a huge way in recent years and the 2015 is a powerhouse, an instant classic (we mentioned 95 points, right??). Huge, brooding, deep, dark Cabernet, with masses of black fruit and leather, earth and exotic spice, this is a HUGE, serious wine that any hedonist will love. Antonio Galloni at Vinous said: “fabulous...what a beautiful wine...rich and unctuous…”. BUT (always with the buts...!) - it's super-limited as you might expect...please lock some up FAST!!

Free ground shipping on 2 or more bottles.

95 points

“The 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon Reserve is fabulous. Rich and unctuous in the glass, but without losing its classic feel, the Reserve conveys the richness of the vintage nicely. Black cherry, cr?me de cassis, smoke, licorice and sweet spice infuse the resonant, super-inviting finish. What a beautiful wine this is.”

~Vinous

“The deep crimson color of this wine hints at the intensity of the 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon — concentrated and powerful, with a finish that goes on for days.”— Cameron Parry, Director of Winegrowing

Technical Details

  • Country: USA
  • Region: Napa Valley
  • Appellation: Oakville
  • Varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon
  • Vineyard: Groth's Reserve Block
  • Aging/Cooperage: Aged for 22 months in 100% new French oak, followed by over a year of bottle-aging. Coopers: Vernou, Boutes, Sylvain, Quintessence, Seguin Moreau, Radoux, Bel Air, Taransaud
  • Harvest Date: Night Harvested: September 7 – September 22
  • Alcohol: 14.9%

About The Producer

Groth Vineyards & Winery was established in 1982, and they crushed the first grapes for their own wines that same year. Production increased quickly to 30,000 cases by 1984. By 1985, the winery needed full-time attention from Dennis and Judy Groth, so they moved their family to the Oakville property. In 1990 the original winery building was completed; a major expansion of facilities was completed in 2007. Since 1982, Groth Vineyards & Winery has established a solid reputation as an outstanding producer of Napa Valley wines.

“We wanted to keep the business family-owned and operated,” states Judy Groth. “What we couldn’t have anticipated is how much the kids now play a role in our business.” Daughter Suzanne Groth joined the winery, in 1998 and in 2017 took the helm as president. “I hope that those who visit the winery in Oakville feel the element of family,” says Suzanne. “The family works actively in the business every day. We live and are raising the next generation in the vineyard.” Also this is modified for the md5/match is changed but the offer ID is the same
